theses.title: CST Hub: A Web-based Application System for Style Formatting Analysis of UMak CS Thesis Manuscript Using Composite Rule-based Algorithm
theses.authors: Mhike Laurence N. Laconsay-henson S. Bunayog-raphael Jorrel H. Docot-chastine Joy B. Sanqui-aia A. Valles
theses.abstract: This study focuses on developing a system for style formatting analysis of UMak CS Thesis Manuscripts using Composite Rule-Based Algorithm by utilizing Python Libraries such as PyMuPDF, and Tesseract OCR. The system consists of calculating bounding boxes to check the formatting of CS thesis papers, providing a valuable tool for students and professors to efficiently review and reduce formatting errors. The method involves calculating PDF paper size, margins, spacings and defining fonts. Using Tesseract OCR and PyMuPDF, the system extracts text details, detects margins, and calculates text spacings. The model detects the errors by highlighting them with OpenCV specifically fonts, margins, and spacing. Despite difficulties in manual data extraction and time-consuming margin and spacing detection, the developed system proves useful in improving UMak CS Thesis Manuscript formatting, resulting with an overall accuracy rate of 90.66% across various formatting components specifically: margin, spacings, and font-related, with a potential for future refinements. Furthermore, the system evaluation reached an overall rating of 3.55, indicating a general acceptance among Computer Science (CS) students and professors.
theses.keywords: Style Formatting Analysis, Formatting Errors, Composite Rule-based Algorithm, UMak CS Thesis Manuscripts, Text Extraction, Data extraction.

theses.title: A Proposed Network Security for Marb Printing Services
theses.authors: Araneta, Jan Lorry F. - Buenaobra, Kenneth Jr. I. - Dela Vega, Joanne R.
theses.abstract: This study addresses the cybersecurity challenges faced by MARB Printing Services and proposes a network security to enhance protection against cyber threats. The objective is to propose a network security encompassing physical, network, and application security measures for the future expansion of the company. The methodology involves enhancing the existing network with Sophos XG Firewall, Sophos XG XDR, and an improved network layout. Utilizing Cisco devices like routers, switches, and network cabling, along with configuring firewalls, VLAN, RIP, TCP, and WAN, ensures security of critical and confidential information, maintaining the company's operational stability. Additionally, Windows Server 2022 is recommended for centealized user management and secure file storage. Results indicate that both IT professionals and employees, achieving a composite evaluation mean of 4.04, indicating strong agreement on its effectiveness. Key outcomes include better identification and mitigation of security flaws, enhanced data protection, and efficient traffic management. The continuous surveillance and proactive measures, such as regular alerts and training, contribute to building trust among clients and partners. Recommendations include designing for future expansion, collaborating with cybersecurity experts, adopting new technologies, and developing a comprehensive incident response plan to maintain and enhance security measures as the cybersecurity landscape evolves.This study serves
theses.keywords: Cybersecurity challenges, Network security, Physical security measures, Network security measures, Application security measure.

theses.title: A Proposed of Secured Wide Area Network Using Ipsec Virtual Private Network for Alpha plus Property Holdings Corporation
theses.authors: Mariyhela Dennise P. Chan - Bryan Joshua B. Manansala - Mark Edson H. Romarate
theses.abstract: The proposal focused on the enhancement of the network security of Alpha Plus Property Holdings Corporation by implementing a secured Wide Area Network (WAN) using IPsec Virtual Private Network (VPN) technology. The solution involves deploying IPsec VPN for site-to-site and remote access connections, integrating Fortinet security solutions and Google Workspace Business Plus for improved collaboration. The implementation plan includes comprehensive testing to ensure enhanced security, improved performance, and streamlined communication. The proposal aims to provide reliable network infrastructure tailored to the corporation's needs, by utilizing VMWare Workstation, Windows Server 2022, Fortinet FortiGate Firewall, and Cisco Packet Tracer. In compliance with ISO/IEC 27001 standards are emphasized to ensure information security and effective risk management, with the deployed network elements serving as crucial protectors of valuable data and enabling authorized access exclusively. The proposed solution will enhance threat detection and incident response, conduct security audits and vulnerability assessments, and improve the overall security and efficiency of Alpha Plus Property Holdings Corporation's network infrastructure, thereby reducing the risk of data breaches and cyber-attacks.
theses.keywords: (WAN) Wide area network, (IPsec VPN) Internet Protocol Security Virtual Private Network, (ISO/IEC 27001) international standard for information securi

theses.title: A Proposed Wan Infrastructure Design Using an Alternative Next-generation Firewall Utilizing SD-WAN and IPsec VPN for New World Diagnostics (NWD)
theses.authors: Tolosa, Rod Vince M. - Bregias, Mark John M. - Sibal, Jasper L.
theses.abstract: This study examines an alternative next-generation firewall for New World Diagnostics which has the same features and functionalities such as SD-WAN and IPsec VPN, while being more economically viable and suitable to the needs of the organization. This study's topic arose as the organization's current next-generation firewall costs exceeded what the organization was comfortable with, therefore looking for another option. This study will be a testbed and a proposal for a new alternative next-generation firewall and a few tweaks and improvements to the current network design. Incorporating related literature and studies enabled the researchers to possess more insight, understanding, and knowledge in the undertaking of this study's completion. Simulations and tests were also done on the proposed network designs, particularly the local area network (LAN) and the wide area network (WAN) for basic functionalities such as VLANs and DHCP to more complex features such as SD-WAN and IPsec VPN. Finally, the proposed network design was evaluated by IT specialists and users from New World Diagnostics, this enabled the researchers to have a holistic evaluation and review of the proposal, and also support its integrity. This study's results proved that alternative next-generation firewalls suited the needs of organizations similar to New World Diagnostics with top-of-the-line features such as SD-WAN and IPsec VPN. theses.keywords: Network Infrastructure Design, Wide Area Network (WAN), Local Area Network (LAN), Software Defined Wide Area Network (SD-WAN), IPsec VPN, Next-Generat

theses.title: A Proposed Web Application with Cloud-based Security for Integrative Learning Content-based System for Senior High School Students of President Diosda
theses.authors: Ormido, John Mark M. - Paz, Jhet Christian V. - Vivo, Sarah Erica D.
theses.abstract: This paper helps you understand and know how to develop an online learning management system from the base with the cloud-based security that is reinforced for an additional layer of security for the system which can give peace of mind to the users of the developed project. With the help of the standards that we are utilizing and using nowadays such as AICC, SCORM, API, and cmi5, the developers successfully developed an online learning management system which is for President Diosdado Macapagal High School, this project is addressing the issues of the users of the President Diosdado Macapagal High School like missing requirements, not accurate recordings, missing paper works and many more. Based on the of the results and summary of findings that has the researchers gathered from testing and interviews, the performance efficiency, the PDMHS-LMS gets a weighted average mean of 4.21, compatibility testing also gets a staggering value of 4.2 weighted average mean. In terms of usability, the PDMHS-LMS has the weighted average mean of 4.31, lastly, reliability, reliability gets a 4.20 weighted average mean. This capstone project addresses the unique challenges faced by Mandalyong College of Science and Technology (MCST), a new institution with a direct internet connection.    This network setup makes MCST vulnerable to cyberattacks and unreliable internet connections. To address these issues, the researchers proposed a comprehensive network architecture to enhance MCST's connectivity, redundancy, scalability, and security. The project focuses on developing a scalable and flexible network infrastructure integrating Inter-VLAN Routing and    EtherChannel Bundling Technology, aiming to establish a resilient and adaptable network for current and future needs. Key objectives include optimizing the local area network, vast area network, server management, and network security using tools like Cisco Packet Tracer and GNS3, aligning with ISO 27001:2022 standards. The study used a Likert Scale to evaluate Organizational Control, Physical Control, Technological Control, Redundancy, Scalability, and Reliability, yielding positive results from evaluators. theses.abstract: This paper explores the development and evaluation of a web-based platform for sexuality education, aimed at addressing the lack of comprehensive sexuality education materials in educational institutions. Chapter 1 delves into the background of the issue, highlighting the challenges faced in implementing comprehensive sexuality education in the Philippines. Chapter 2 reviews related literature, providing insights from various studies on sexuality education, online resources, and the effectiveness of web-based programs. In Chapter 5, the study's findings, conclusions, and recommendations are presented. The findings indicate that the developed web-based platform performed well in terms of performance efficiency, usability, security, functionality, and maintainability, as evaluated based on ISO 25010 standards. Conclusions drawn from the study emphasize the importance of web-based tools in delivering comprehensive sexuality education and the need for continuous improvement in such platforms. Recommendations include adding a summative test and implementing a certification system to enhance student learning and engagement. Overall, this study contributes to addressing the challenges in providing comprehensive sexuality education through innovative technological solutions.

The application's purpose was to identify and eliminate unnecessary entries from the system, as well as improve data quality and accuracy during information display via interactive dashboard visualizations. The research design used by the researchers is design thinking approach which promotes innovation, empathy, and continuous problem-solving, enabling the development of user-centered solutions that effectively address complex challenges. The approach focused on detecting dirty data and duplications that could not be captured by the traditional method used by receptionists and dentists. It is an important approach for cleaning dirty data and identifying duplications, enabling the researchers to identify inaccurate data. The methodology of the study also includes the data flow diagrams as well as the testing and evaluation procedures that will be used to assess the system's overall functionality. theses.title: Development of Facilities and Equipment Management System for Barangay Santol
theses.authors: Abundo, Precious Apple Dini-ay, Jonalyn S. - Tusing, Lawrence John P.
theses.abstract: The capstone project titled "Development of Facilities and Equipment Management System for Barangay Santol" seeks to revolutionize asset management by addressing the urgent need for an efficient tracking and management system for barangay assets, encompassing buildings, equipment, and vehicles. The primary goal is to design and implement a robust, user-friendly system that empowers barangay officials to monitor assets, schedule maintenance, plan replacements, and optimize resource utilization with precision and ease. Through a thorough analysis, the project identifies existing challenges in the current asset management practices, aiming to not only resolve these issues but also proactively anticipate and mitigate potential risks associated with asset mismanagement, loss, or inefficiencies. Emphasizing user convenience, the system is designed to be intuitive and accessible, ensuring that it meets the practical needs of barangay officials. Integral to the system's architecture are stringent access control mechanisms grounded in the CIA Triad principles (Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability), guaranteeing robust security to protect sensitive data and information input by users, thus fostering a secure and efficient asset management environment for Barangay Santol.
theses.keywords: Asset inventory management, Threat Mitigation Approach, CIA Triad, Facilities and Equipment.

theses.abstract: The Skybarangay system is a comprehensive solution designed to streamline and modernize the processing of barangay documents in Barangay Western Bicutan. Traditionally, the processing of essential documents such as barangay certificates, certificates of indigency, barangay clearances, business permits, and blotter complaints has been handled manually, resulting in long lines and congestion. This project aims to address these challenges by automating and digitizing the procedures in the barangay. The proponents introduced hard-coded security features to protect against malicious users and safeguard sensitive matters within the barangay. To further enhance convenience and ease of access, physical hardware like kiosks will be positioned thoughtfully around the barangay. "The researchers hope to increase worker productivity and enhance resident satisfaction by putting the Skybarangay system into place. To guarantee the system's success, a test plan was established, and an evaluation was carried out with IT professionals, residents, and employees. The evaluation findings revealed a ""High"" of satisfaction, with a mean score of 3.3. This encouraging feedback demonstrates the Skybarangay system's effectiveness in increasing barangay efficiency and improving resident service quality. In conclusion, the Skybarangay system is a huge step forward for Barangay Western Bicutan, providing a more modern and efficient method to handling critical barangay services."

To solve these problems, this proposal puts forward many technologies and measures for protection, such as port security, high availability failover, centralized management through Active Directory, more robust security with FortiGate Firewall, and cloud-based backup solutions. These improvements aim to enhance integrity within networks, reduce downtimes, and ensure that critical services continue working at all times without interruptions. The survey findings from the project show that most people agree with the effectiveness and suitability of these changes in their organization's structure related to information systems management. According to respondents' comments about control types introduced by this initiative towards improving security levels while minimizing operational times, it can be concluded that success has been realized in terms of making physical access impossible except for authorized personnel, thus reducing risks emanating from unauthorized entry into buildings housing computers or other sensitive data storage devices used within Mandalyong. The methodology details research, technology, and security measures for a web-based scholarship management system, aiming to enhance efficiency, accessibility, and security, while outlining key features to streamline operations. Additionally, Windows Server 2022 is recommended for centralized user management and secure file storage. The continuous surveillance and proactive measures, such as regular alerts and training, contribute to building trust among clients and partners. Recommendations include designing for future expansion, collaborating with cybersecurity experts, adopting new technologies, and developing a comprehensive incident response plan to maintain and enhance security measures as the cybersecurity landscape evolves. Asides from the basic features and functionalities that are present on a typical e-commerce system, there are also security features implemented in this study. Security features that are included in this study is Multi-Factor Authentication and bcrypt. Multi-Factor Authentication is a standard security feature implemented on most systems and software applications, it works by verifying the authenticity of a user by requesting a unique one-time pin or OTP sent to their email account upon registering on the system. On the other hand, Bcrypt's purpose is to secure data stored in the backend of applications by using a cryptographic hash function that turns a user's password into a specific number characters unrecognizable to its original form. The system will be evaluated by using ISO 25010 Product Quality Model Evaluation that assesses a system or software application based on a specific criterion. In this study, the system will be evaluated based on its functionality suitability, interaction capability, reliability, security, and maintainability by three groups. theses.title: Securing and Optimizing Network Through Ips and Site-to-site Ipsec Vpn for Pricon Microelectronics
theses.authors: Cavan, Daryl M. - Navarro, Kyle David A. - Tamayo, Rodolf John O.
theses.abstract: The growing reliance on computer networks needs comprehensive cybersecurity measures for companies like Pricon Microelectronics Inc. This project documents the development of an enhanced security solution for Pricon's network, which includes Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) and a Site-to-Site iPSEC VPN. The project commenced with a thorough assessment of Pricon's network environment. This initial phase identified potential security vulnerabilities and evaluated the specific threats Pricon's network faced. The risk assessment provided the foundation for selecting the most suitable security solutions. Based on the network security assessment, Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) were chosen to actively monitor and block malicious traffic attempting to infiltrate Pricon's network. Additionally, a Site-to-Site IPSEC VPN was implemented to establish secure encrypted communication channeis between Pricon's locations or with partner networks. The project meticulously details the selection process, configuration, and integration of these security solutions into Pricon's existing network infrastructure. Following implementation, rigorous testing procedures were conducted to validate the effectiveness of the IPS and VPN solutions. These tests ensured that the security measures functioned as intended, safeguarding Pricon's network from identified threats. The growing reliance on computer networks needs comprehensive cybersecurity measures for companies like Pricon Microelectronics Inc.

theses.title: Securing Micro Image International Corporation: A Proposed Zero-trust Network Architecture for Data Protection and Risk Mitigation
theses.authors: Banaag, Adrian P. - Mamayo, Sittie Janine D. - Vicera, Paul Joshua L.
theses.abstract: This capstone project proposes a comprehensive Zero Trust Network Architecture (ZTNA) solution to strengthen the security posture of Micro Image International Corporation (MIC). The project addresses the growing security concerns of MIC in light of recent cyber threats. ZTNA significantly improves over traditional perimeter-based security by enforcing continuous authentication of users and devices throughout network sessions. This approach minimizes the potential impact of security breaches by assuming all entities (users, devices, applications) are untrusted. The ZTNA solution leverages Cisco Duo for multi-factor authentication (MFA), adding an extra layer of security to user logins and restricting unauthorized access. Granular access control further tightens security by limiting access to authorized resources only. The solution also encompasses a secure Wide Area Network (WAN) connection for secure data exchange with sister companies. This WAN connection utilizes Fortinet FortiGate firewalls and Site-to-Site VPN to ensure robust data protection. The firewalls provide additional security features like application control, user authentication, and web filtering. The project recommends a phased approach with user training, security policy reviews, and ongoing threat detection practices to ensure successful implementation. The project also emphasizes the importance of vendor selection and equipment compatibility assessment. By implementing the proposed TNA solution and secure W
theses.keywords: Zero-Trust Network Architecture (TNA), Network Security, Data Protection, Micro Image International Corporation (MIIC), Wide Area Network (WAN), Site-

theses.authors: Abundo, Precious Apple-dini Ay, Jonalyn S.-tusing, Lawrence John P.
theses.abstract: The capstone project titled \"Development of Facilities and Equipment Management System for Barangay Santol\" seeks to revolutionize asset management by addressing the urgent need for an efficient tracking and management system for barangay assets, encompassing buildings, equipment, and vehicles. The primary goal is to design and implement a robust, user-friendly system that empowers barangay officials to monitor assets, schedule maintenance, plan replacements, and optimize resource utilization with precision and ease. Through a thorough analysis, the project identifies existing challenges in the current asset management practices, aiming to not only resolve these issues but also proactively anticipate and mitigate potential risks associated with asset mismanagement, loss, or inefficiencies. Emphasizing user convenience, the system is designed to be intuitive and accessible, ensuring that it meets the practical needs of barangay officials. Integral to the system\'s architecture are stringent access control mechanisms grounded in the CIA Triad principles (Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability), guaranteeing robust security to protect sensitive data and information input by users, thus fostering a secure and efficient asset management environment for Barangay Santol.
theses.keywords: Asset inventory management, Threat Mitigation Approach, CIA Triad, Facilities and Equipment.

theses.title: Development of Intellicam: An Information Management System to Secure Closed-circuit Television Data
theses.authors: Arabaca, Woody Allens G.-baltazar, John Aaron R.-carlos Jr., Delfin A.
theses.abstract: In the contemporary landscape of surveillance technology, Closed-Circuit Television (CCTV) systems are vital for security in various sectors. This study investigates the vulnerabilities and challenges facing CCTV systems in Barangays Pitogo, Pembo, and West Rembo. Through interviews, concerns such as data overwriting, the need for Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), cloud-based storage vulnerabilities, the importance of a digitally auditable trail, and violence prevention measures are uncovered. A proposed solution aims to address these issues with a tailored approach for each barangay, leveraging advanced security measures and contemporary technologies. The study\'s significance lies in strengthening CCTV system security, providing stakeholders like local government, barangay officials, law enforcement, disaster risk reduction offices, and community residents with increased safety and security. The methodology, incorporating Design Thinking and adhering to ISO 25010 standards, ensures the reliability of assessing system pertormance. This literature review also explores the critical aspects of Design Thinking, its integration into organizational culture, its significance in design education, and theoretical foundations, particularly within the constructivist learning theory framework. Ultimately, this research enhances surveillance infrastructure, benefiting both current and future community stakeholders.
theses.keywords: Closed-Circuit Television (CCTV), Two-Factor Authentication. Cloud-based Storage. Violence prevention, Disaster Risk Reduction, Design Thinking, ISO 2

theses.title: Development of Propertease: "A Property Information and Security Management System"
theses.authors: Chavez, Jan Axcel V.-garcia, Mary Joyce D.-garcia, Shaine Marie C.
theses.abstract: The real estate industry faces significant challenges in managing their property-related data. Golden Home Realty relies merely on spreadsheets, which are vulnerable and prone to human errors and Data breaches. As a result of manual input can have severe consequences, underscoring the critical importance of information security. In response, the development of PropertEASE: \"A property information and security management system\" emerges as a robust web application designed to address these complexities, and it ensures information confidentiality and privacy through multi-factor authentication via email verification, data encryption and system with its database for more secure data storage and quick and easy navigation, allowing them to manage their property information and security more efficiently. The development process involves phases such as planning, system design, development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance. By adhering to these phases, PropertEASE aims to create a robust property information and security management system that meets user needs and delivers value. PropertEASE promises to benefit everyone in the real estate game. Golden Home Realty Dev. Inc. can streamline data management, employees can be more productive, and property owners gain peace of mind. Buyers, sellers, and tenants all win with accurate information and a smoother transaction process. By prioritizing trust and reliability, PropertEASE has the potential to revolutionize the real es
theses.keywords: Information Security Management System, PropertEASE Management.

theses.title: Enhancing Business Continuity Through Virtualization: Utilizing Cloud Storage and Sync for Disaster Recovery
theses.authors: Joveres, Michelle M.-malinao, Florence B.-tan, Charles Vincent D.
theses.abstract: This research synthesizes a network infrastructure design and configuration plan for Obanana Corp, integrating proactive security protocols and industry best practices. By meticulously addressing specific objectives, including the design of local and wide area networks, implementation of AWS services, and integration of disaster recovery measures, the study aims to enhance organizational resilience and operational efficiency. Proactive measures such as firewall security applications and access management protocols ensure robust network security across multiple floors of the PMI Tower. Rigorous testing and validation procedures validate the reliability and performance of the implemented infrastructure, paving the way for a smooth transition and minimal disruption to operations. By adopting these recommendations, Obana Corp can navigate future technological advancements effectively while safeguarding the integrity and security of its IT infrastructure. Overall, putting these steps into practice will greatly improve Obanana Corp\'s technology setup, ensuring strong security, better day-to-day operations, and a solid base for handling future tech changes.
theses.keywords: Network Infrastructure, AWS Services, Disaster Recovery, Firewall Security Applications, Network Connection, GNS3, Firewall Configuration, Cloud Infra

theses.title: Rise and Thrive: A Web-based Platform to Promote Kalinga Culture, Products, and Services
theses.authors: Ariaga, Ma. Angelica C.-collado, Mariecolle G.-lineses, Kenneth O.-piojo, Rainlyn
theses.abstract: In an age marked by digital connectivity and global trade, the potential of e-commerce to uplift marginalized communities is evident. This study focuses on the development of an e-commerce platform for the indigenous population of Kalinga, Philippines, aimed at promoting their rich cultural heritage and empowering their economic endeavors. The proposed platform, Rise and Thrive, seeks to address the challenges faced by indigenous entrepreneurs, including limited market access and authenticity issues, by providing a dedicated marketplace with features designed to prioritize authenticity, cultural significance, and data security. The significance of this research lies in its pioneering launch of an e-commerce platform tailored specifically for the indigenous population of Kalinga, Philippines. it is for economic empowerment and cultural preservation, the platform offers Kalinga immediate benefits in expanding market reach and connecting with a global audience. By fostering sales growth and positioning Kalinga as a cultural hub, the platform attracts tourism and reinforces the authenticity of indigenous offerings, aside from that it uses technologies such as PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and MySQL, the platform incorporates measures in security and a payment method to ensure user confidence. Testing and evaluation based on ISO 25010 criteria ensure the platform\'s functionality and adherence to standards of confidentiality, integrity, non-repudiation, and accountability. The study
theses.keywords: Kalinga, E-Commerce, Indigenous Products, Kalinga Culture, Indigenous WeBSIT-NSe

theses.title: Sagip Ani: Nurturing Agricultural Prosperity Through an E-commerce Web Application for Marketing Agricultural Products of Pakisama Confederation
theses.authors: Malabanan, James B.-rana, Josiah Caleb B.-saludes, Razia Princess Joy T.
theses.abstract: This study aims to develop a secure web-based e-commerce system for the Pambansang Kilusan ng mga Samahang Magsasaka confederation (PAKISAMA). The system will allow basic e-commerce transactions between customers and admins like purchasing and selling products while securing user data. Asides from the basic features and functionalities that are present on a typical e-commerce system, there are also security features implemented in this study. Security features that are included in this study is Multi-Factor Authentication and bcrypt. Multi-Factor Authentication is a standard security feature implemented on most systems and software applications, it works by verifying the authenticity of a user by requesting a unique one-time pin or OTP sent to their email account upon registering on the system. On the other hand, Bcrypt\'s purpose is to secure data stored in the backend of applications by using a cryptographic hash function that turns a user\'s password into a specific number characters unrecognizable to its original form. The system will be evaluated by using ISO 25010 Product Quality Model Evaluation that assesses a system or software application based on a specific criterion. In this study, the system will be evaluated based on its functionality suitability, interaction capability, reliability, security, and maintainability by three groups. Each group is composed of 10 individuals which are e-commerce platform users, PAKISAMA employees, and IT specialists. The results of t
theses.keywords: Agriculture, E-commerce, Web Application, Bcrypt, PAKISAMA Confederation, Bcrypt, Security

theses.title: The Development of Hivestock: An Enhanced Solution for the Inventory Management System (LMS) of Nikka Trading
theses.authors: Barrameda, Ginalyn M.-jimenez, Charina M.-labaniego, Angeline Marie D.
theses.abstract: The capstone project, \"The Development of HiveStock: An Enhanced Solution for the Inventory Management System of Nikka Trading, \" is a direct response to the urgent need for a more effective inventory management system. The current system, characterized by manual procedures, obsolete software, and limited visibility, is not only outdated but also poses significant challenges for Nikka Trading. The review of related literature strengthens the proposed study by providing a comprehensive understanding of the current state of knowledge in the field. The study used a descriptive research design to thoroughly examine the project\'s objectives and scope, which involved a comprehensive analysis of existing research on inventory management systems, technological advancements, and recent industry developments. Moreover, the evaluation results with a high rating indicate that the system could meet the following ISO 25010 standards, such as its usability and compatibility. With an average total rating of 3.89, interpreted as \"Acceptable\" in terms of functionality, reliability, performance efficiency, usability, compatibility, security, maintainability, and portability. manual inventory management processes and decentralized spreadsheet reliance further compound the issue, introducing errors and hindering operational efficiency. The proposed solution, a modern inventory management system, offers real-time visibility, streamlined supply chain operations, and strategic integration with
theses.keywords: inventory management system, data entry, logistics, technology

theses.title: VMeme: A Secured Contemporary Art Gallery
theses.authors: Dual, Maria Pamella B.-erguiza, Jendan Kremlin C.-nieva, Sabrina Joy P.
theses.abstract: The pandemic and technological advancements have propelled e-commerce and online sales to new heights, requiring businesses to adapt and establish a robust digital presence. MEME, an art gallery, recognized this shift but faced limitations with its outdated weBSIT-NSe. To address this, the researchers developed the MEME: A Contemporary Art Gallery e-commerce weBSIT-NSe, tailored to enhance their online reach and meet specific needs. The site encompasses essential e-commerce functionalities such as account management, favorites lists, customization options, and QR code payments, along with advanced features like automatic watermarking and artist\'s profile management. Ensuring quality and compliance, the weBSIT-NSe underwent evaluation by art enthusiasts and technology experts guided by the ISO 25010 standards, covering aspects like aesthetics, user experience, security, and accessibility. Employing a descriptive research approach guided by Bhat\'s framework, data was collected to understand visitor demographics, interests in contemporary art, and security preferences, enabling the gallery to better cater to its audience. The updated weBSIT-NSe is fully functional across major browsers, ensuring data security with password protection. It significantly improves on the previous version, seamlessly integrating core e-commerce tools like account management, order processing, and anti-plagiarism measures. Robust cybersecurity protocols, including QR code payments, OTP authenticatio
theses.keywords: Outdated weBSIT-NSe, Digital Presence, Ecommerce WeBSIT-NSe, Automated Watermarking

theses.title: Redesign a Secured and Hybrid Network Infrastructure for Eulogio “AMANG” Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST)
theses.authors: Mendoza, Dave B. - Mongado, Ranzel C. - Paragas, Ezekiel B.
theses.abstract: The study at the Eulogio "Amang" Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST) aims to redesign its hybrid network infrastructure to address issues of network delays and downtime. The redesign incorporates a structured cabling system, additional access points, subnetting, and redundant switches, adhering to the TIA/EIA 569-C standards. By integrating services such as DHCP for efficient resource management and security, the study employs tools like Cisco Packet Tracer and VMware for thorough network simulation and configuration. Utilizing a descriptive research design, the methodology encompasses planning, development, testing, and evaluation phases. The evaluation of the redesigned network, guided by ISO 27001:2022 standards, indicates high satisfaction levels among IT experts and users concerning the newly implemented organizational, physical, and technological controls. The findings highlight significant improvements in network performance and security, with users expressing substantial satisfaction. The integration of additional access points enhances wireless coverage and reduces congestion, while subnetting improves network segmentation and traffic management. Redundant switches increase the network's reliability by providing backup paths in case of hardware failure. The deployment of structured cabling ensures a more organized and efficient network infrastructure, facilitating easier maintenance and scalability. Overall, the study successfully demonstrates the

theses.title:
EroHub: The Development of a Learning Management System Utilizing Hybrid Filtering Technique in Forum Discussion
To Enhance Students Engagement
theses.authors: Marie Anne S. Cabbab - Cherry Mae P. Cantones - Ian Marco S. Castillo - Florenz C. De Jesus
theses.abstract:
This research paper introduces EroHub, a Learning Management System (LMS) designed and developed to enhance student engagement. It employs a hybrid filtering technique and integrates gamification elements within the forum. This study combines content-based filtering and collaborative filtering with the Weighted Approximate-Rank Pairwise (WARP) algorithm to create a more personalized and interactive learning platform. It combines developmental and descriptive research methods and follows the Agile Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). The evaluation, using a set of metrics including precision, recall, AUC score, and MRR, compares the filtering techniques, excluding content-based filtering, each utilizing WARP and BPR. The evaluation shows that hybrid filtering with WARP outperforms BPR in terms of item ranking
recommendation. The paper discusses the challenges encountered by Erovoutika, gathered through interviews and survey questionnaires, providing a basis for the development of the Learning Management System (LMS). An evaluation of the system based on ISO 25010 standards, conducted with 50 respondents, revealed high levels of agreement on its functional suitability, performance efficiency, interaction capability, and flexibility. Respondents also provided positive feedback on the gamification elements, including points, achievement badges, levels, challenges, and ranking. In conclusion, this study successfully developed a Learning Management System (LMS) that meets user n
theses.keywords: Learning Management System, Forum Gamification, Hybrid Filtering, Collaborative Filtering, Content-Based Filtering, WARP, BPR

theses.title: Webderm: Machine Learning Model on Web-based Skin Disease Prediction System Using MobileNet Architecture
theses.authors: Bumanlag, Patricia G. - Eisma, Justine Jake G. - Lupango, Jun Lander P. - Merto, John Ray U. - Narag, Marco M.
theses.abstract: This study evaluated the efficacy of WebDerm, a web-based tool for identifying seven types of skin diseases using deep learning algorithms. The researchers extracted a gap that despite the development of machine learning algorithms, effectively diagnosing many skin conditions simultaneously remains difficult, and due to the possibility of shared symptoms, the need for distinct treatments, and the high risk of human error associated with conventional diagnostic procedures, it can be challenging to distinguish many skin disorders at once. In order to address this problem, the current study concentrated on creating a web-based skin disease prediction system that consists with the following features including image upload, multi-file upload, a Home Remedies module, an Online Appointment module, an Administrator Module, and a user-friendly interface that was designed, developed, and improved as part of the research. The researchers used the Agile Development Model for the web-based skin disease prediction system. These benefits include Requirement, Design, Development, Testing, Deployment, and Review. The researchers evaluated user satisfaction and gathered comments for potential improvements using a developmental approach. Metrics concerning the application's usability and user satisfaction been included in the survey form. The significant finding that the study indicates that the performance or compliance of the evaluated aspects aligns well with the ISO standards and meets or e
theses.keywords: Deep Leaming Algorithms, Home Remedies, Mobile Camera Use, Multiple Image Upload, Skin Diseases, Web-Based Skin Disease Prediction System.

theses.title: A Proposed SD-WAN Architecture Using Cloud-Delivered Security Solutions for Nextrade Philippines Inc.
theses.authors: Karl Matthew P. Palmaira - Jess Andrew I. Reguine - Exequiel Mico U. Sales
theses.abstract: The researchers of this Capstone Project have worked in addressing the existing issues and concerns in network security for NexTrade Philippines Inc. The effectiveness and efficiency of the network security system is required for a company in order to reduce a company's liabilities, insurance, compensation, and other social security costs to stakeholders in the event of it experiencing a network attack or failure. Organizations should also take into consideration of improving its revenue while lowering the operational costs to utilize the company's budget effectively. To further asses the problems and its solutions, an interview was conducted together with looking up various studies regarding the implementation of SD-WAN or Software-Defined Wide Area Network and its features that focuses on security to an organization's network infrastructure. In order to address the issues in the increase of latency and stability that comes with internet connections that are long distance, the researchers proposed a SD-WAN architecture. Policies under server management were also proposed by the researchers in order to ensure user and device compliance to the organization's respective policies and to ensure security within the local area network of the company's offices. The time limit and requirements posed challenges and difficulties to the researchers of this capstone project. The researchers then concluded that organizations that have a main branch and satellite branches must have proper
theses.keywords: Software-Defined Wide Area Network (SD-WAN), Next Generation Firewall (NGFW), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB), Zero-Trust Network Approach (ZTNA),

theses.title: Development of TAICHNO: An Educational Assessment Tool for Taijiquan's Stance with Real-time Accuracy and Feedback Utilizing Blaze Pose Mediapipe Algo
theses.authors: Reynan M. Ersolada - John Simon M. Legaspi - Honey Lei B. Lizardo - Christine Joy B. Pelayo - Ronnielyn S. Valenzuela
theses.abstract: This research paper introduces the development of a web-based application TAICHNO, an educational assessment tool designed to provide real-time accuracy and feedback on Taijiquan stances. TAICHNO utilizes MediaPipe's BlazePose algorithm, a deep learning- based pose estimation model, to analyze the user's posture during stance training. The system provides visual feedback on the users in comparison to ideal Taijiquan stance parameters. This real-time assessment can enhance learning efficiency and promote accurate stance acquisition for Taijiquan practitioners. TAICHNO bridges the gap by harnessing advanced technology, specifically the BlazePose MediaPipe algorithm, to offer real-time assessment and feedback on stances. The development approach utilized Agile Data Science and a data-driven approach to application development. The researchers used ISO 25010 standards to evaluate the web application in the form of a survey questionnaire. Beyond TAICHNO, the paper studied about traditional Chinese mind-body exercise, emphasizes proper stance for balance, stability and demands both physical alignment and mental focus. This study delves into the nuanced intricacies of eight traditional stances: Horse Stance (Ma Bu), Bow-Arrow Stance (Gong JianBu), Sitting on Crossed Legs Stance (Zuo Pan Bu), Four-Six Stance (Si Liu Bu), Tame the Tiger Stance (Fu Hu Bu), False Stance (Xuan Ji Bu or Xu Bu), Golden Rooster Standing on One Leg Stance (Jin Gi Du Li), and Squat Stance Zuo Dun). Through a
theses.keywords: Taijiquan, MediaPipe Algorithm, Human Pose Estimation, Confusion Matrix, FeedForward Neural Network, BlazePose

theses.title: Development of TAGA-TSEK: An Educational Grammar Checker Tool for Pokus Ng Pandiwa Explored Using Distilbert Algorithm
theses.authors: Ryan Jay M. Acosta - Matthew D. Bierneza - Jonny P. Sagloria - Jeimee Nicole P. Salvador - Shaina V. Vinoya
theses.abstract:
This study investigated the morphological transfer of Tagalog grammar with a focus on Pokus ng Pandiwa using the DistilBERT method. To improve language accuracy and competency in Tagalog, the study intended to create and develop an educational grammar checker tool in Pokus ng Pandiwa that reliably recognized these grammar rules. The educational tool has the following features: grammar checker, modules, quizzes, and games for Filipino teachers and students. Artificial intelligence sentences generated, validated, and corrected by professionals in the field were used in the study to train the DistilBERT algorithm. The study's focus had been strictly on Pokus ng Pandiwa, leaving out other grammatical conventions and terms that were not Tagalog. The preparation of the Tagalog corpus, application of appropriate grammatical rules, and use of DistilBERT for analysis were all part of the research strategy. Precision, Recall, and Fl score were used for training evaluation and ISO 25010 was used to evaluate the system. Furthermore, the results of actual testing proved that the developed educational grammar checker tool was able to enhance language accuracy and proficiency in Pokus ng
Pandiwa resulting in an overall accuracy of 86%.
theses.keywords: Natural Language Processing, Grammar Checking, DistilBERT, Tagalog language, Pokus ng Pandiwa.

theses.title: Development of APYRO: Smart Attendance System for Hyflex Learning in Higher Education Using Convolutional Neural Network Algorithm
theses.authors: Jan Kent Amiel O. Diego - Jilbert P Lim - Khrizza C. Persona - Leonardo G. Timkang Jr. - Patrick J. Etesam
theses.abstract:
Studies revolving around attendance systems have been an enduring focus of research. Over the past decade, various solutions have been proposed, each aiming to enhance efficiency and reduce time consumption. However, each individual system has its own flaws and errors. With the emergence of hyflex learning and the social issues it presents in onsite and virtual classes, the lack of familiarity can lead to challenges in effectively tracking attendance and addressing the specific needs of this environment. This study introduces a new approach to attendance systems in hyflex learning using modern techniques,
specifically machine learning. The researchers utilized the pre-trained SSD MobileNet V1, a convolutional neural network-based model, to create a face recognition model by applying transfer learning techniques. During the development of the model, face images and face annotations were gathered as part of the data collection process serving as the target training data for validation and testing. After the model was developed, the researchers created a web application called APyro using the agile methodology approach and implemented the trained model along with the developed system. The system and the models were evaluated using different metrics. The overall outcome of the system addressed specific social issues in the hyflex modality, offering a potential solution to some challenges faced in attendance tracking in this setting.
theses.keywords: Hyflex learning, SSD MobileNet V1, transfer learning, convolutional neural network, agile methodology, model evaluation.

theses.title: Development of AISTILO: A System for Preserving Philippine Artistic Heritage Through Neural Style Transfer Techniques with Domain Adaptation
theses.authors: Jose Renan A. Gasidan - Jose B. Gayares III, Angel Kaye B. Macatuhay - Novem Jan Dzel L. Sayman - Marielle M. Zabala
theses.abstract: Arts and culture are the least explored fields in computer vision and machine learning studies. This research addresses the challenge of preserving the art and culture of the Philippines. Implementing Neural Style Transfer and VGG 19, a computer vision model, the study develops a method for integrating Filipino art styles into digital images through the AISTILO application. Quality evaluation of generated images was conducted using two metrics: Learned Perceptual Image Patch SimilarityLPIPS) and Human Eye Perceptual Evaluation (HYPE), which showed an inverse relationship. The style transfer model demonstrated consistent performance in both metrics. However, with a T-statistics of 4.50 and a P-value of 0.02 on Paired T-test the evaluation of two metrics have statistically significant differences. Further assessment of the AISTILO app based on ISO 25010 standards for functionality, performance and security obtained high user satisfaction scores: 3.45 for functional suitability, 3.29 for performance efficiency and 3.36 for security which all interpret to "Strongly agree". While the study confirms the help of technology in cultural preservation, it also presents the need for continued improvement and long term evaluation. High app ratings show Filipinos support digital takes on tradition, which could help keep Filipino culture alive for future generations..
theses.keywords: Style transfer, Domain adaptation, Cultural Artistic Heritage, Transfer Learning

theses.title: TRAINAPAW: Development of Dog Training Recommender Application with Hybrid Filtering Techniques for Fun & Wild Dog Training Services and Rehabilitatio
theses.authors: Jessie Q. Chua - Ghen Paul D. Dulin - John Patrick C. Isidoro - Webster III D. Tolosa - Jenelia Rose N. Bueno
theses.abstract: This thesis study presents TrainaPaw, a mobile application that provides dog owners with personalized training recommendations. By examining its design, user experience, and performance, the study delves into the system architecture, which integrates K-Nearest Neighbors, content-based filtering, and collaborative filtering techniques to generate training recommendations based on user input and a database of training content. The study further analyzes survey findings, which reveal user preferences and suggest improvements such as more detailed trainer profiles, a resource library for dog training materials, and enhanced announcements and reviews. Finally, the study concludes with an ISO 25010 assessment of TrainaPaw to evaluate its functionality, user experience, and security features. The researchers found that the combination of the K-Nearest Neighbors algorithm and hybrid filtering techniques was highly effective in recommending personalized dog training, achieving a precision of 90.38%, recall of 88.83%, accuracy of 88.83%, and an F1 score of 88.35%. This application aims to significantly enhance dog owner engagement by providing porsonalized recommendations and fostering a deeper understanding of the importance of dog training. By establishing clear boundaries, facilitating social connections, and strengthening the bond between dogs and their owners, effective training benefits both human and canine companions.
theses.keywords: Dog Training Recommender System, Hybrid Filtering, Collaborative Filtering, Content-Based Filtering, K-Nearest Neighbors.

theses.title: Peso Masters: An Educational Card Game Application in Financial Literacy for Kids Using Fisher-yates Algorithm and Greedy Algorithm
theses.authors: Edrianne Loise A. Agrava - Jed Angeli C. Cleofe - Mark Genesis S. Dumayas
theses.abstract:
Financial literacy involves the ability to properly manage personal finances, including earning, saving, spending, borrowing, and protecting assets. Being skilled in making wise financial decisions contributes to financial stability and freedom. This study focuses on applying the Fisher-Yates Algorithm for shuffling and randomizing a deck of cards and the Greedy Algorithm to aid decision-making in the game "Peso Masters." "Peso Masters" is a 2D educational game developed in Unity to teach basic financial literacy concepts to children aged 8 to 9 years old. The Agile Methodology was used in software development, and various research designs were adopted, including developmental and descriptive (descriptive evaluative) research methodologies and simple random sampling methods. After developing the game, the researchers conducted an evaluation targeting children aged 8 to 9 years old. The evaluation was done online; the game was uploaded to itch.io, and survey questions were distributed via Google Forms. Most respondents were children in the target age group, and the game received the highest rating for functional suitability. However, only a few respondents provided feedback and suggestions for improvement.
The results indicate the game's credibility, suggesting that with some improvements, it could effectively teach financial literacy to children aged 8 to 9 years old.
theses.keywords: Financial literacy, Fisher Yates Algorithm, Greedy Algorithm, Educational Game, Card Game

theses.title: Development of Chrono Clash: A Strategic Board Game Utilizing K-nearest Neighbors and Minimax Algorithm for Possible Game Players Movement
theses.authors: Emmanuel Christian D. Dalida - Nikko B. Dulay - Michael Dave C. Garcia - Juztin Rafhael C. Gonatice - Fernan R. Retardo
theses.abstract:
This thesis explores the transition of the traditional board game to digital, focusing on the development of Chrono Clash, a mobile game that applies algorithms to enhance player engagement and tactical skills. Utilizing a developmental research approach, the game underwent iterative design based on player feedback, supported by comprehensive planning, and literature review. Also, the game adopted a Game Development Life Cycle (GDLC) methodology to develop the game. The incorporation of k-nearest neighbors and minimax algorithm in gameplay resulted in significant improvements in player
engagement and critical thinking skills. While the dataset is currently limited, the KNN algorithm performs well in the confusion matrix, achieving a balanced accuracy of
around 70% (weighted average of precision, recall, and F1-score). Moreover, minimax with pruning offers a significant advantage by creating game outcome analysis, the researchers concluded that depth suggests well during the testing. Games played using this algorithm exhibit fewer player moves and shorter overall match times compared to games without Minimax. An evaluation of the game using ISO-25010 resulted in a score of 4.04, indicating high marks in functionality, performance, flexibility, and interaction. =Overall, players have a positive impression of the game's design, and features suggest a strong potential for market success.
theses.keywords: Decision Tree, K-Nearest Neighbor, Minimax Algorithm, Minimax with Pruning, Confusion Matrix, ISO-25010, Game Development Life Cycle (GDLC)

theses.title: ITHINK: Implementation of Pattern Matching Algorithm in the Development of Game Based Learning Python Tutorial for Beginners

theses.title: Development of UMEP: An Augmented Reality Wayfinding Digitalizing the Health and Physical Science Building Evacuation Plan Using A* Algorithm and Indo
theses.authors: Ranger C. Enoja - Aldrian B. Escarlan - Sheerymae P. Curameng - Ezequel B. Lingal - Francisco A. Bleza
theses.abstract: This research investigates the effectiveness of the University of Makati Evacuation Plan (UMEP), an Augmented Reality (AR) wayfinding application designed to enhance emergency preparedness within the university's Health and Physical Science Building. UMEP leverages AR technology, the A* pathfinding algorithm, and a QR code-based Indoor Positioning System (IPS) to guide users during evacuation drills. It offers real-time navigation by pinpointing the shortest escape route and tracking user location. The study employs a mixed-methods approach, combining a descriptive review of existing evacuation plan practices and developmental approach that follows AGILE methodology for building UMEP application. The purposive sampling technique participated by 120 students from the College of Computing and Information Sciences (CCIS). Data collection was facilitated through an ISO 25010-compliant user-survey questionnaire, with statistical analysis providing insights into UMEP's usability and effectiveness. Functional testing verified the application's components, with detailed metrics demonstrating the successful implementation and performance of the AR, A* algorithm, and IPS features. While the study identified limitations, user feedback indicated positive perceptions. UMEP received positive feedback for its functionality, usability, reliability, efficiency, and compatibility. This suggests UMEP can be a valuable tool for emergency preparedness training. Its engaging features and user-frie
theses.keywords: A* Algorithm, Augmented Reality, Evacuation Plan, Indoor Positioning System, QR code

theses.title: Development of College Degree Program Recommender System for Incoming Freshmen Students Using Classification Technique
theses.authors: Emmanuel Joseph M. Bermas - Paul Joshua Dl. Carreon - John Anthony T. Cenon - Neil Fritz C. Ciriaco - Leann B. Sarza
theses.abstract: The thesis presents a College Program Recommender System designed to assist incoming first-year students in selecting suitable college programs. The system used the Random Forest algorithm exclusively for classification purposes, to provide personalized recommendations. The study addresses the challenges faced by grade 12 students in selecting appropriate programs, emphasizing the potential consequences of program mismatch leading to job mismatch in the future. It underscored the necessity for an efficient recommender system to assist students in making informed decisions. The researchers obtained and preprocessed academic data from past students, including course histories, interests, and performance records. They developed and tested the algorithms, revealing that Random Forest successfully captured patterns in academic data, enabling the recommender system to provide credible program suggestions. The accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score of the algorithms were also assessed to determine their suitability for the task. The study contributes significantly to academic counseling by providing a realistic solution to the issues faced by incoming freshmen during program selection. The test results clearly demonstrate that the Random Forest algorithm achieved 97% accuracy. The findings support the system's use of Random Forest to provide accurate and trustworthy program choices for incoming college students, addressing the complexity inherent in academic program selection.
theses.keywords: College Program Recommendation System, Random Forest, program selection

theses.title: The Development of E-BASA: An Interactive Reading Application with Implementation of Shuffling Algorithm to Enhance Learning in Filipino Subject
theses.authors: Alejandro R. Cerafica Jr. - Kathlyn Mangoba - Fortune Matthew A. Tamares - Elijah Theodore S. Yabut
theses.abstract:
This research, "E-BASA," an interactive reading application employing a Shuffling algorithm to enhance Filipino language learning, makes a significant contribution to educational technology by showcasing the effectiveness of personalized apps. This study uses the Shuffling algorithm to create a more personalized and interactive platform. It is a combination of developmental and descriptive evaluative research methods and utilizes the Agile Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). The evaluation, using the probability metric, shows that the Fisher-Yates algorithm outperforms the linear congruent and Sattolo cycles. Fisher-Yates has the lowest probability of 9.05%, which is the best in terms of the probability that the questions occur, followed by linear congruence (10.48%) and Satollo cycle (11.36%).
This paper discusses the problems encountered by E-BASA, gathered through interviews and a pre-survey that allow us to identify user requirements, challenges, and pain points, providing a basis for the development of E-BASA. An evaluation of the system based on the ISO 25010 standards, conducted with 50 respondents, resulted in the second-highest level of agreement, which is "agree" on its functional suitability, performance efficiency, flexibility, and interaction capability. Respondents also provided positive feedback on the features, including the pre-test, test creation, classroom creation, and progress report. In conclusion, this study successfully developed an interactive rea
theses.keywords: Interactive reading application, Shuffling Algorithm, Fisher-Yates Algorithm, Linear Congruence, Sattolo Cycle Algorithm, Probability Metric

theses.title: Development of Pitch It Perfect: A Mobile Flute Recorder Musical Note Recognition Application Using Convolutional Neural Network Model
theses.authors: John Kenneth S. Camarador - Israel Ephraim V. Esteban - Russel John S. Evangelista - Lee Rasheed M. Rebodos
theses.abstract: This research aimed to design and develop an Android application that can detect soprano recorder notes in music, which then can be deployed to help individuals who wish to learn to play music but do not wish to read sheet music. Hence, the researchers developed a Convolutional Neural Network-based Android application for soprano recorder note recognition, which was designed and developed by using Android Studio, Google Firebase, and Retrofit. The Android application classifies musical notes in a piece of music. It displays the label and how it should be performed via an image-based guide that illustrates which Soprano Recorder instrument holes should be covered to play the displayed note. The research design utilized in this investigation is a mixed-method approach, combining quantitative and developmental research methodologies. Given the emphasis on utilizing data, the chosen research methodology for this investigation is the Team Data Science Process (TSDP). This approach allows for a structured and data-driven analysis of the research objectives. The ISO 25010 software quality standard is employed for evaluating the quality of Android applications. The researchers gathered 348 survey responses based on ISO 25010 from two groups of participants: 279 UMak students and 69 Soprano Recorder player UMak students. According to the survey result and the verbal interpretation of responses from UMak students and Soprano Recorder play UMak students, the performance efficiency and p
theses.keywords: Music Information Retrieval, Neural Networks, Soprano Recorder Instrument, Note Recognition, Convolutional Neural Networks, Android application

theses.title: The Development of LIB-RO: An Android Mobile and Web Application for Automated Record Keeping in Small Businesses Using Computer Vision OCR Algorithm
theses.authors: Howard G. Bayquen - Atthaleen M. Carlos - Justine Louise T. Carunungan - Raiden V. Guillergan
theses.abstract:
Small businesses are important for promoting economic growth in today's business environment. However, due to their limited resources and time, a lot of small businesses find it challenging to handle manual bookkeeping techniques. The objective of this project is to automate small business recordkeeping tasks through the development of Lib-Ro, a web and mobile application. Lib-Ro enables the extraction and classification of bills/invoices and receipts into three categories: expense, owner's equity, and revenue by utilizing computer vision Optical Character Recognition technology and Artificial Neural Network models. The development involved collaborative efforts with industry partners, including Group Management Corporation, The Benthel Development Corporation, 107 Hub, and 1735 Corporation, who provided support and data for the project. Support vector machines, decision trees, random forest, logistic regression, convolutional neural networks, and gradient boosting with XGBoost were used to assess the neural network. The results showed that the artificial neural network achieved high accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score of eighty-four percent (84%), eighty-four percent (84%), eighty-four percent (84%), and eighty-three percent (83%) respectively. Evaluation based on ISO/IEC
25010 standards revealed high ratings for functionality sustainability and reliability, though usability metrics garnered lower scores. Moreover, project evaluation highlighted the app's strong perfor

theses.title: FITLIFE PRO: A Web-based Platform Empowering Filipinos to Overcome Barriers and Achieve Health and Wellness Goals
theses.authors: Managay, Jenzer Kane M - Garcia, Terenz Gwayn E
theses.abstract: This research paper introduces FitLife Pro, a virtual health and wellness coaching platform aimed at addressing the prevalent challenges individuals face in maintaining optimal health and fitness. With increasing awareness of the importance of physical activity and healthy living, many still struggle due to financial constraints, lack of guidance, time limitations, and motivational barriers. FitLife Pro offers personalized exercise routines, nutritional guidance, and motivational features to empower individuals to take control of their well-being. The project follows a systematic approach, starting with problem definition, research, system design, development, implementation, testing, and evaluation. Leveraging Agile software development methodology, FitLife Pro is designed to meet user needs effectively. It incorporates key features such as personalized workout plans, nutrition guidance, progress tracking, and social networking capabilities. Using Python Flask Framework and Microsoft Azure SQL Database, FitLife Pro ensures scalability, security, and usability. The platform adheres to ISO/IEC 25010:2023 standards, guaranteeing high functionality, reliability, usability, and security. Rigorous testing procedures and pilot testing with a small user group provide valuable feedback for refinement. FitLife Pro aims to revolutionize the health and wellness industry by providing accessible, personalized, and cost-effective solutions. Through continuous evaluation and refinement, it
theses.keywords: Health and wellness coaching platform, Health and wellness solutions, FitLife Pro, diet apps

theses.title: The Development of a Secure Live Streaming Platform with Phishing Attack Resistance for Obanana
theses.authors: Ga, James Francis F. - De Torres, Ryan Justine P.
theses.abstract:
The developed secure live streaming platform features a digital place where Obanana's audience base can interact with each other through activities such as live social engagement and quizzes that earn them points to their wallet. The platform aims to provide Obanana with a realtime web application model that can contribute in expanding their audience base and interactions as a B2C technology company, while implementing security and WebAuthn that provides protection from various phishing attacks as the user attempts to authenticate within the platform, with secure coding practices taken into account. The attacks may include credential stuffing, brute force attacks, session hijacks, SQL injections, XSS, and CSRF, which are known to compromise user accounts and even potentially bypass 2FA methods. The main stack includes Laravel, PHP, JavaScript, NextJS, and WebRTC, deployed as a web application to the cloud. The testing reveals that the developed platform passed the test procedures, performance test (Lighthouse), and security tests (Burp Suite and OWASP ZAP). Evaluation of the platform from client users, IT experts and Obanana employees resulted in highly acceptable ratings across 8 indicators of the ISO/EC 25010 quality assessment framework.
The researchers concluded that the developed live streaming platform with phishing resistance is mostly safe, reliable, and easy to use based on the survey conducted.

theses.abstract: Online help desk is implemented in industries to answer inquiries and assist those in need. The Municipality of Pateros struggles to keep up with issues inside the municipality. Considering they have ten barangays with a growing population. the current on-call system might not be reliable since it is prone to altercations. Different departments from the municipality also have concerns that need to be addressed. With those, it can be unorganized and a hassle to deal with. This study aims to develop Assis Tech, an online help desk with an administrator account that can cater to staff and residents' concerns with their tickets. It also has a chatbot that answers frequently asked questions to minimize the administrator's workload and is integrated with two-factor authentication to ensure the system's security, preventing unwanted access. This system will increase the municipality's accessibility to assist its residents and staff hassle-free, no matter where they are It also allows users to create accounts, which undergo the process of verification by the administrator. Based on the survey conducted by the researchers using ISO 25010 to evaluate the system, IT Professionals, Employees, and Residents gave excellent remarks in each survey category. The researchers successfully developed the system with the features and security integration. This will encourage the Municipality of Pateros to work on issues and concerns in an organized manner. theses.title: The Development of Salus: An Electronic Medical Record System Utilizing Advanced Encryption Standard
theses.authors: Buenaventura, Ara Beatriz B. - Funa, Princess Richell C. - Santuele, Clyde Lenon A.
theses.abstract: The Electronic Medical Record System (EMRS) represents a cutting-edge digital solution tailored for Taguig Pateros District Hospital and similar healthcare institutions, revolutionizing how patient health records are managed. This system enhances the efficiency of healthcare delivery by digitizing the creation and maintenance of patient records, which are readily accessible to healthcare professionals during consultations. Key features include patient registration, profiling, reports, and appointment scheduling. These functionalities significantly boost operational processes and enhance the overall efficiency of clinical staff. A critical objective of the EMRS is to improve healthcare organizations performance and security. The system employs robust security measures, such as the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm, which uses a 256-bit key length to encrypt and decrypt data both in transit and at rest. This ensures the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive patient information. To further protect against web-based threats, the system utilizes Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection and HTTPonly cookies to secure login requests and safeguard session data. User authentication is fortified through Two-factor Authentication (2FA), which verifies the identity of users, adding an extra layer of security. Additionally, Role-based Access Control (RBAC) is implemented to assign specific authorization levels to users, ensuring that access to sensitive information is
theses.keywords: Advanced Encryption Standard, Electronic Medical Records System, Cross-site Request Forgery, HTTPOnly, Role-based Access Control, Audit Trail, Two-fac

theses.title: Asian Hospital Health Data Hub: Development of Research Information System for Asian Hospital
theses.authors: Bueno, Revin R. - Generao, Jonas G. - Mejillano, Bea Bianca R.
theses.abstract: The Hospital Research Information System is a web-based software application tailored for Asian Hospital aimed at modernizing and enhancing the research process within the institution. The Hospital Research Information System aims to digitize and optimize research workflows within Asian Hospital. By leveraging technology, the hospital aims to overcome challenges associated with manual processes. The research design for developing a research information system for Asian Hospital adopts a descriptive approach to address its research process challenges. The study begins with an introduction outlining the need for Enhanced effectiveness and optimized user satisfaction in the research process. A literature review explores successful implementations and challenges faced by similar systems in research settings providing insights to inform the de development process. The study evaluated the web systems functionality, reliability, usability, and security and the results showed that the web system has excellent performance and usability and is reliable and secure. Results of testing reveal that research is reliably recorded and kept in the database and the weBSIT-NSe is compatible with a range of devices and browsers assuring easy accessibility and operation. theses.abstract: This research synthesizes a network infrastructure design and configuration plan for Obanana Corp, integrating proactive security protocols and industry best practices. By meticulously addressing specific objectives, including the design of local and wide area networks, implementation of AWS services, and integration of disaster recovery measures, the study aims to enhance organizational resilience and operational efficiency. Proactive measures such as firewall security applications and access management protocols ensure robust network security across multiple floors of the PMI Tower. Rigorous testing and validation procedures validate the reliability and performance of the implemented infrastructure, paving the way for a smooth transition and minimal disruption to operations. By adopting these recommendations, Obanana Corp can navigate future technological advancements effectively while safeguarding the integrity and security of its IT infrastructure. Overall, putting these steps into practice will greatly improve Obanana Corp's technology setup, ensuring strong security, better day-to-day operations, and a solid base for handling future tech changes.

theses.title: Securing Micro Image International Corporation: A Proposed Zero-trust Network Architecture for Data Protection and Risk Mitigation
theses.authors: Banaag, Adrian P. - Mamayo, Sittie Janine D. - Vicera, Paul Joshua L.
theses.abstract: This capstone project proposes a comprehensive Zero Trust Network Architecture (ZTNA) solution to strengthen the security posture of Micro Image International Corporation (MIIC). The project addresses the growing security concerns of MIC in light of recent cyber threats. ZTNA significantly improves over traditional perimeter-based security by enforcing continuous authentication of users and devices throughout network sessions. This approach minimizes the potential impact of security breaches by assuming all entities (users, devices, applications) are untrusted. The TNA solution leverages Cisco Duo for multi-factor authentication (MFA), adding an extra layer of security to user logins and restricting unauthorized access. Granular access control further tightens security by limiting access to authorized resources only. The solution also encompasses a secure Wide Area Network (WAN) connection for secure data exchange with sister companies. This WAN connection utilizes Fortinet FortiGate firewalls and Site-to-Site VPN to ensure robust data protection. The firewalls provide additional security features like application control, user authentication, and web filtering. The project recommends a phased approach with user training, security policy reviews, and ongoing threat detection practices to ensure successful implementation. The project also emphasizes the importance of vendor selection and equipment compatibility assessment. By implementing the proposed ZTNA solution and secure
theses.keywords: Zero-Trust Network Architecture (ZTNA), Network Security, Data Protection, Micro Image International Corporation (MIIC), Wide Area Network (WAN), Site

theses.title: Development of a Web-based Sexuality Education Platform for Adolescents
theses.authors: Benitez, Trixie May C. - Garcia, Jahmel Andre C. - Gramatica, Julius A
theses.abstract: This paper explores the development and evaluation of a web-based platform for sexuality education, aimed at addressing the lack of comprehensive sexuality education materials in educational institutions. Chapter 1 delves into the background of the issue, highlighting the challenges faced in implementing comprehensive sexuality education in the Philippines. Chapter 2 reviews related literature, providing insights from various studies on sexuality education, online resources, and the effectiveness of web-based programs. In Chapter 5, the study's findings, conclusions, and recommendations are presented. The findings indicate that the developed web-based platform performed well in terms of performance efficiency, usability, security, functionality, and maintainability, as evaluated based on ISO 25010 standards. Conclusions drawn from the study emphasize the importance of web-based tools in delivering comprehensive sexuality education and the need for continuous improvement in such platforms. Recommendations include adding a summative test and implementing a certification system to enhance student learning and engagement. Overall, this study contributes to addressing the challenges in providing comprehensive sexuality education through innovative technological solutions.
theses.keywords: Web-based Sexuality Education, Sexuality Education Platform, Learning Management System

The goal of this study was to create a web application for TeethTalk dental clinic that includes basic dental clinic management system functions like patient information management and easy access to dental/medical history, as well as advanced features like data cleaning and deduplication, data analytics, and two-factor authentication. The application's purpose was to identify and eliminate unnecessary entries from the system, as well as improve data quality and accuracy during information display via interactive dashboard visualizations. The research design used by the researchers is design thinking approach which promotes innovation, empathy, and continuous problem-solving, enabling the development of user-centered solutions that effectively address complex challenges.
