theses.title: Designing a Scalable and Flexible Network Architecture for Mandaluyong College of Science and Technology with Inter-vlan Routing and Etherchannel Bund
theses.authors: Bustillo, Paul Naethan P. - Chua, Julius S. - Rocha, Nathaniel Glenn M.
theses.abstract: As digital technologies rapidly expand, educational institutions must innovate with strong network infrastructures to support diverse academic and administrative activities. This capstone project addresses the unique challenges faced by Mandalyong College of Science and Technology (MCST), a new institution with a direct internet connection. This network setup makes MCST vulnerable to cyberattacks and unreliable internet connections. To address these issues, the researchers proposed a comprehensive network architecture to enhance MCST's connectivity, redundancy, scalability, and security. The project focuses on developing a scalable and flexible network infrastructure integrating Inter-VLAN Routing and EtherChannel Bundling Technology, aiming to establish a resilient and adaptable network for current and future needs. Key objectives include optimizing the local area network, vast area network, server management, and network security using tools like Cisco Packet Tracer and GNS3, aligning with ISO 27001:2022 standards. The study used a Likert Scale to evaluate Organizational Control, Physical Control, Technological Control, Redundancy, Scalability, and Reliability, yielding positive results from evaluators. Successful testing validated the proposed project's functionality and reliability. This project enhances MCST's network infrastructure, providing practical insights and methodologies for newly established institutions. It lays a resilient foundation for the future growth of
theses.keywords: Digital Technology, Network Infrastructure, Cyberattacks, Redundancy, Scalability, Inter-VLAN Routing, EtherChannel Bundling, Digital technologies

theses.abstract: This proposal suggests comprehensive network infrastructure enhancement to boost the reliability and security of Mandaluyong City Hall's network. There are currently weaknesses in the system's security, frequent periods of unavailability, and the system cannot be scaled up adequately. To solve these problems, this proposal puts forward many technologies and measures for protection, such as port security, high availability failover, centralized management through Active Directory, more robust security with FortiGate Firewall, and cloud-based backup solutions. These improvements aim to enhance integrity within networks, reduce downtimes, and ensure that critical services continue working at all times without interruptions. The survey findings from the project show that most people agree with the effectiveness and suitability of these changes in their organization's structure related to information systems management. According to respondents' comments about control types introduced by this initiative towards improving security levels while minimizing operational times, it can be concluded that success has been realized in terms of making physical access impossible except for authorized personnel, thus reducing risks emanating from unauthorized entry into buildings housing computers or other sensitive data storage devices used within Mandaluyong. theses.title: CST Hub: A Web-based Application System for Style Formatting Analysis of Umak Cs Thesis Manuscript Using Composite Rule-based Algorithm
theses.authors: Mhike Laurence N. Laconsay - Henson S. Bunayog - Raphael Jorrel H. Docot - Chastine Joy B. Sanqui - Aia A. Valles
theses.abstract: This study focuses on developing a system for style formatting analysis of UMak CS Thesis Manuscripts using Composite Rule-Based Algorithm by utilizing Python Libraries such as PyMuPDF, and Tesseract OCR. The system consists of calculating bounding boxes to check the formatting of CS thesis papers, providing a valuable tool for students and professors to efficiently review and reduce formatting errors. The method involves calculating PDF paper size, margins, spacings and defining fonts. Using Tesseract OCR and PyMuPDF, the system extracts text details, detects margins, and calculates text spacings. The model detects the errors by highlighting them with OpenCV specifically fonts, margins, and spacing. Despite difficulties in manual data extraction and time-consuming margin and spacing detection, the developed system proves useful in improving UMak CS Thesis Manuscript formatting, resulting with an overall accuracy rate of 90.66% across various formatting components specifically: margin, spacings, and font-related, with a potential for future refinements. Furthermore, the system evaluation reached an overall rating of 3.55, indicating a general acceptance among Computer Science (CS) students and professors.
theses.keywords: Style Formatting Analysis, Formatting Errors, Composite Rule-based Algorithm, UMak CS Thesis Manuscripts, Text Extraction, Data extraction.=

theses.title: A Web-Based Barangay Resident Information System
theses.authors: Araza, Ashley Travis - Catig, Cesar B. Jr - Tobias, Jan Earl M.
theses.abstract: In order to address the difficulty that has been affecting the barangay North Signal in Taguig City, the goal of this study is to offer a solution. The strategy involved developing a digital information system for the barangay to serve as a tool for addressing manual processes. A web-based system known as the Barangay Information System is equipped with functionalities for storing, processing, generating, and managing resident's information. The system ensures the security of the system through the implementation of authorization, employing a one-time password (OTP) for additional layer of security to authenticate users during login, ensuring that only the legitimate account holder can perform actions or access sensitive information. Information was properly protected utilizing encryption, decryption and data backup mechanisms, including reCAPTCHA for validating users distinguishing between bots and humans. To develop an information management system, the proponents utilized the PHP programming language. Furthermore, this generate an online backup of the user's information to maintain data integrity that assures the information of the users are stored securely within the system. This significantly optimize the management of residence documents and information for Barangay North Signal residents. The research acknowledged that the system has limitations, such as security in biometrics, online transactions, and chatbot. Overall, the research indicates that implementing a web-ba
theses.keywords: Resident Information System, Web-based, PHP, reCAPTCHA, OneTime Password, Encryption and Decryption, Backup, Digital, North Signal, Taguig City

theses.title: A Proposed of Secured Wide Area Network Using IPsec Virtual Private Network for Alpha plus Property Holdings Corporation
theses.authors: Mariyhela Dennise P. Chan - Bryan Joshua B. Manansala - Mark Edson H. Romarate
theses.abstract: The proposal focused on the enhancement of the network security of Alpha Plus Property Holdings Corporation by implementing a secured Wide Area Network (WAN) using IPsec Virtual Private Network (VPN) technology. The solution involves deploying IPsec VPN for site-to-site and remote access connections, integrating Fortinet security solutions and Google Workspace Business Plus for improved collaboration. The implementation plan includes comprehensive testing to ensure enhanced security, improved performance, and streamlined communication. The proposal aims to provide reliable network infrastructure tailored to the corporation's needs, by utilizing VMWare Workstation, Windows Server 2022, Fortinet FortiGate Firewall, and Cisco Packet Tracer. Compliance with ISO/IEC 27001 standards are emphasized to ensure information security and effective risk management, with the deployed network elements serving as crucial protectors of valuable data and enabling authorized access exclusively. The proposed solution will enhance threat detection and incident response, conduct security audits and vulnerability assessments, and improve the overall security and efficiency of Alpha Plus Property Holdings Corporation's network infrastructure, thereby reducing the risk of data breaches and cyber-attacks
theses.keywords: (WAN) Wide area network, (IPsec VPN) Internet Protocol Security Virtual Private Network, (ISO/IEC 27001) international standard for information securi

theses.title: Development of Facilities and Equipment Management System for Barangay Santol
theses.authors: Abundo, Precious Apple - Dini-ay, Jonalyn S. - Tusing, Lawrence John P.
theses.abstract: The capstone project titled "Development of Facilities and Equipment Management System for Barangay Santol" seeks to revolutionize asset management by addressing the urgent need for an efficient tracking and management system for barangay assets, encompassing buildings, equipment, and vehicles. The primary goal is to design and implement a robust, user-friendly system that empowers barangay officials to monitor assets, schedule maintenance, plan replacements, and optimize resource utilization with precision and ease. Through a thorough analysis, the project identifies existing challenges in the current asset management practices, aiming to not only resolve these issues but also proactively anticipate and mitigate potential risks associated with asset mismanagement, loss, or inefficiencies. Emphasizing user convenience, the system is designed to be intuitive and accessible, ensuring that it meets the practical needs of barangay officials. Integral to the system's architecture are stringent access control mechanisms grounded in the CIA Triad principles (Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability), guaranteeing robust security to protect sensitive data and information input by users, thus fostering a secure and efficient asset management environment for Barangay Santol.
theses.keywords: Asset inventory management, Threat Mitigation Approach, CIA Triad, Facilities and Equipment.

theses.title: Sagip Ani: Nurturing Agricultural Prosperity Through an E-commerce Web Application for Marketing Agricultural Products of Pakisama Confederation
theses.authors: Malabanan, James B. - Rana Josiah Caleb B. - Saludes, Razia Princess Joy T.
theses.abstract:
This study aims to develop a secure web-based e-commerce system for the Pambansang Kilusan ng mga Samahang Magsasaka confederation (PAKISAMA).
The system will allow basic e-commerce transactions between customers and admins like purchasing and selling products while securing user data. Asides from the basic features and functionalities that are present on a typical e-commerce system, there are also security features implemented in this study. Security features that are included in this study is Multi-Factor Authentication and bcrypt. Multi-Factor Authentication is a standard security feature implemented on most systems and software applications, it works by verifying the authenticity of a user by requesting a unique one-time pin or OTP sent to their email account upon registering on the system. On the other hand, Bcrypt's purpose is to secure data stored in the backend of applications by using a cryptographic hash function that turns a user's password into a specific number characters unrecognizable to its original form. The system will be evaluated by using ISO 25010 Product Quality Model Evaluation that assesses a system or software application based on a specific criterion. In this study, the system will be evaluated based on its functionality suitability, interaction capability, reliability, security, and maintainability by three groups. Each group is composed of 10 individuals which are e-commerce platform users, PAKISAMA employees, and IT specialists. The results of the
theses.keywords: Agriculture, E-commerce, Web Application, Bcrypt, PAKISAMA Confederation, Bcrypt, Security

theses.title: Development of Propertease: "A Property Information and Security Management System"
theses.authors: Chavez, Jan Axcel V. - Garcia, Mary Joyce D. - Garcia, Shaine Marie C.
theses.abstract: The real estate industry faces significant challenges in managing their property-related data. Golden Home Realty relies merely on spreadsheets, which are vulnerable and prone to human errors and Data breaches. As a result of manual input can have severe consequences, underscoring the critical importance of information security. theses.title: An Enhanced Wide Area Network Infrastructure for Dost Central Office: Optimized Firewall and System Network Deployment
theses.authors: Canonce, Edrian T. - Delica, Cedric John C. - Lagasca, Kaye M.
theses.abstract: The technology has evolved on how information are exchanged and WANs are the backbone of this interconnected world. However, the complexity of WANs also shows on how organizations expose their security challenges. This research focuses on the development, evaluation and testing of the "Enhanced Wide Area Network Infrastructure for DOST Central Office: Optimized Firewall and System Network Development". The goal was to design an improved wide-area network infrastructure with VPN, redundancy, scalability, and quality of service control. Employing a Descriptive Approach research design, the research incorporated Likert scales administered to IT Professionals. Positive evaluations from the participants emphasized the proposed network infrastructure's satisfactory in terms of functionality, reliability, usability and security. Therefore, the researchers concluded based on the results, that the proposed network infrastructure function works as intended: access switch, core switch, router and firewall are integrated well. With a total mean score of 4.1 out of 5, the proposed network infrastructure demonstrates that the functionality, reliability and usability of the network infrastructure was rated satisfactory. theses.keywords: enhanced wide area network infrastructure, WAN, access switch, core switch, router, firewall, IPSec tunnel, redundancy, scalability, VPN, DOST

The University of Makati was established in 1972, with the envisioned school as an instrument that provides University Education to mold Makati youth as productive citizens. theses.title: Rise and Thrive: A Web-Based Platform to Promote Kalinga Culture, Products, and Services
theses.authors: Ariaga, Ma. Angelica C. - Collado, Mariecolle G. - Lineses, Kenneth O. - Piojo, Rainlyn
theses.abstract: In an age marked by digital connectivity and global trade, the potential of e-commerce to uplift marginalized communities is evident. This study focuses on the development of an e-commerce platform for the indigenous population of Kalinga, Philippines, aimed at promoting their rich cultural heritage and empowering their economic endeavors. The proposed platform, Rise and Thrive, seeks to address the challenges faced by indigenous entrepreneurs, including limited market access and authenticity issues, by providing a dedicated marketplace with features designed to prioritize authenticity, cultural significance, and data security. The significance of this research lies in its pioneering launch of an e-commerce platform tailored specifically for the indigenous population of Kalinga, Philippines. it is for economic empowerment and cultural preservation, the platform offers Kalinga immediate benefits in expanding market reach and connecting with a global audience. By fostering sales growth and positioning Kalinga as a cultural hub, the platform attracts tourism and reinforces the authenticity of indigenous offerings, aside from that it uses technologies such as PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and MySQL, the platform incorporates measures in security and a payment method to ensure user confidence. Testing and evaluation based on ISO 25010 criteria ensure the platform's functionality and adherence to standards of confidentiality, integrity, non-repudiation, and accountability. The study'
theses.keywords: Kalinga, E-Commerce, Indigenous Products, Kalinga Culture,Indigenous WeBSIT-NSe
